GeneDef.label: command animal
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene can command animals to fight by their side for several hours.\n\nTo ensure no mistakes are made the super must command each animal one by one. This tends to be worth the effort though as there aren't many things that can stop a herd of angry muffalos and elephants from leveling a fortified location.

GeneDef.label: heroic leap
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to make long leaps that cover a lot of ground, usually involving a three-point landing at the end.\n\nIn glitterworld cities, use of this ability was banned due to multiple accidents involving a super breaking their legs or accidentally landing on someone.

GeneDef.label: seal wounds
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to almost perfectly seal the wounds of a nearby pawn. This will not restore lost blood or completely heal the wound, but it will stop bleeding and aid the healing process greatly.\n\nRecently this ability is often overlooked on the battlefield due to the existence of superclotting and regeneration genes, but it was originally designed to create super medics who would use this in combination with the resurrection power to create an unstoppable army.

GeneDef.label: throw spike
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to summon a spike that is launched at a larget at high speeds.\n\nWhile its damage is relatively low, the fact that it is extremely accurate and has exceptional armor penetration makes it very dangerous.

GeneDef.label: revive
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to revive a nearby pawn.\n\nJust as the superhero gene frequently makes people believe the super is a demigod or god, this ability frequently makes people believe that this super is some sort of demon or other undefined evil their religion fights.

GeneDef.label: invisibility
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to turn invisible for a short time every few hours.\n\nWhile there are many who worry that supers with this gene are going to sneak into places they shouldn't be, countless studies have found that it is far more likely that supers with this gene prefer to do harmless jump scares because watching people get spooked amuses them.

GeneDef.label: blink
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to blink themselves away from a location. The destination is a random point between 20 and 30 tiles away. Using this to get out of danger will either work very well, or very poorly.\n\nThis ability was initially developed when a super with a psylink was spooked during some testing. After discovering how well teleportation abilities worked with the superhero gene, military scientists sought to create a controlled version of this ability.

GeneDef.label: teleportation
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to teleport themselves and any other living thing a short distance away.\n\nExpanding on the super's ability to randomly teleport, this was used as a way to get melee focused supers behind enemy lines. Sometimes middlemen were completely removed, and the super would teleport themselves into enemy lines, blinking out the moment things began going poorly.

GeneDef.label: teleportation gate
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to teleport themselves everyone within 10 tiles to any location where the colony has people.\n\nAfter developing teleportation, the next logical step was to find a way to get squads of soldiers from one front to another front quickly. The end result was the creation of porters who would take squads of supers quickly from battle to battle, single-handedly turning the tides of wars.

GeneDef.label: teleportation rift
GeneDef.description:
Carriers of this gene are able to teleport themselves everyone within 200 tiles to any location where the colony has people.

This will teleport almost everyone on the current map to the desired location. If you use this in your colony, you will need to send someone back manually to be able to teleport back.

When a losing battle turned devastating because the army's porter couldn't get enough people out of the fortification fast enough, this ability was developed to give supers a way to move entire platoons quickly. Moving a battalion quickly still required multiple porters, but teleportation rifts made the task only require 10% of the people it did before.

GeneDef.label: psychic disconnection
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to temporarily render people psychically deaf. This gene requires that the carrier does not have any other genes that manipulate their own psychic sensitivity.

GeneDef.label: mass stone shift
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to move massive amounts of stone chunks to a specified location instantly.

GeneDef.label: stunning attraction
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to make every being around them become inexplicably attracted to them for a brief time. The pawns will automatically move towards the caster.\n\nThis is affected by stun susceptibility.

GeneDef.label: narcissus
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to put a seed of narcissistic thoughts into a target's head, blooming into an internal distraction with a duration based on how much beauty they have.

GeneDef.label: distraction
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to distract a target, stunning them for a time based on the stun susceptibility.

GeneDef.label: untouchable beauty
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to increase their melee dodge chance based on how much beauty this pawn has for an hour.

GeneDef.label: regenesis
GeneDef.description:
Carriers of this gene can put allies into a coma-like state. While in this state, the pawn will begin regenerating all wounds, and if in the coma for long enough, they will begin slowly regrowing lost parts. The pawn only requires 25% of their normal food intake.

After a set number of days, the regeneration will become stronger.
 - 0 days: Begin slowly healing scars
 - 5 days: Scar healing rapidly accelerated
 10 days: - Regrow 1 part every 5 days
 - 15 days: Regrow 1 part every 2 days

WARNING: The only thing that can wake a pawn in regenesis is a pawn with the regenesis gene. The carrier cannot target themselves, so as long as they continue to survive, you should be able to wake your pawns without issue.

GeneDef.label: retractable fist blades
GeneDef.description:
Supers with this gene have blades that shoot out from inside their forearm to be extended well beyond their fist, granting them a new way to slice and dice.

They were initially referred to as claws by general public, but the scientific community decided on the more dry name of "retractable fist blades" by arguing that A, they don't come out of the fingers, and B, they are almost as long as the individuals forearm. Normal people still call them claws though, because nobody wants to remember a name as long as "Fist Blade Retractor".

The exact nature of the claws tends to vary slightly between users, with some having multiple thinner ones protruding from the knuckles, and some just having it extend from their wrist. They don't have any actual difference in effects, so they all get to be in one gene.

GeneDef.label: superhero laser eyes
GeneDef.description: Superheroes with this gene can shoot powerful lasers from their eyes.\n\nPlease make sure you go give Biotech Gene: Laser-Eyes a thumbs up for making this gene possible. Now on with the lasering!

GeneDef.label: flight
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene are able to fly through the air, which can aid them greatly when travelling both short and long distances.\n\nWhile an infant, supers with this gene are still unable to fly around. However, as they age they quickly learn how to move themselve around by simply willing themselves to move in a direction.

customEffectDescriptions.li: Colonist will always be floating at least a little bit over the ground.

GeneDef.label: detect metal horror
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene can place marks on themselves and everyone around them that will search through the targets' blood and nervous system for oddities. If a metal horror style oddity is found, the mark releases a pheromone that causes others to know that the individual is infected.

customEffectDescriptions.li: The exact location of a metal horror detected this way is still unknown, meaning they still need to undergo surgeries, but also won't have a metal horror popping out immediately due to this detection.

The ability will apply two hediffs, one that lasts very briefly to let you know the pawn is being searched, and another that only appears if the search finds something. The second one will remain until the hidden horror is gone for any reason.

GeneDef.label: telepush
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene can attempt to teleport a target backwards a bit, assuming the area behind the target is clear.

GeneDef.label: telepull
GeneDef.description: Carriers of this gene can attempt to teleport a target backwards a bit, assuming the area behind the target is clear.
